intro: Steudelia viridis, commonly known as greenstem sandmat, is a low-growing annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically has slender, branched stems covered in fine, white hairs. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, often with a bluish-green hue, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Steudelia viridis thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
